intro: Heterotoma lobelioides subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smoothleaf heterotoma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The subspecies glabra is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous leaves, which are typically lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. This plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as habitat for various insects.
